##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-04T11:00:35.000Z ##

While the April 2024 security bulletin for Android didn't contain anything severe, the corresponding April 2024 bulletin for Pixel devices disclosed active exploitation of two vulnerabilities tracked as CVE-2024-29745 and CVE-2024-29748 flaws. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-two-pixel-zero-day-flaws-exploited-by-forensics-firms/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-03T14:29:04.000Z ##

Babe wake up, new Google Pixel zero-days just dropped: ð https://source.android.com/docs/security/bulletin/pixel/2024-04-01

  • CVE-2024-29745 (information disclosure, high severity)
  • CVE-2024-29748 (elevation of privilege, high severity)

Note: There are indications that the following may be under limited, targeted exploitation.

EDIT: Reported by security researcher Daniel Micay of GrapheneOS Foundation who reported that the vulnerabilities were exploited in the wild by forensics companies ð https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/112204428984003954

CVE-2024-29745 refers to a vulnerability in the fastboot firmware used to support unlocking/flashing/locking. Forensic companies are rebooting devices in After First Unlock state into fastboot mode on Pixels and other devices to exploit vulnerabilities there and then dump memory. We proposed zeroing memory in firmware when rebooting to fastboot mode to wipe out the whole class of attacks. They implemented this by zeroing memory when booting fastboot mode. USB is only enabled by fastboot mode after zeroing the memory is completed, blocking these attacks. GrapheneOS already implemented defenses against this attack before we became aware of it. After becoming aware of this attack against Pixels running the stock OS, we improved our existing defenses and added new ones alongside reporting the firmware weaknesses to get those fixed.

CVE-2024-29748 refers to a vulnerability providing the ability to interrupt a factory reset triggered by a device admin app. It appears they've implemented a partial solution in firmware. See https://grapheneos.social/@GrapheneOS/112162304896898942 about ongoing work we spotted on wipe-without-reboot support.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: ð https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/google-fixes-two-pixel-zero-day-flaws-exploited-by-forensics-firms/

#zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_29745 #CVE_2024_29748 #Google #Pixel #Android

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-03T11:43:24.000Z ##

The exploited flaws, tracked as CVE-2024-29745 and CVE-2024-29748, impact Pixelâs bootloader and firmware, Google notes in its advisory. https://www.securityweek.com/google-patches-exploited-pixel-vulnerabilities/

CVE-2024-22423
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-10T17:07:11

4 posts

### Summary The [patch that addressed CVE-2023-40581](https://github.com/yt-dlp/yt-dlp/commit/de015e930747165dbb8fcd360f8775fd973b7d6e) attempted to prevent RCE when using `--exec` with `%q` by replacing double quotes with two double quotes. However, this escaping is not sufficient, and still allows expansion of environment variables. Support for output template expansion in `--exec`, along with

simontsui at 2024-04-10T19:50:43.981Z ##

#BatBadBut is not just one CVE ID CVE-2024-24576 (10.0 critical) affecting Rust programming language. It's also CVE-2024-1874, CVE-2024-22423 (8.3 high, for yt-dlp), and CVE-2024-3566 (for Haskell, node.js, Rust, PHP, yt-dlp)... so far. @ryotkak, a security engineer at Flatt Security Inc. said

"I decided to call this vulnerability BatBadBut because itâs about batch files and bad, but not the worst."

The BatBadBut is a vulnerability that allows an attacker to perform command injection on Windows applications that indirectly depend on the CreateProcess function when the specific conditions are satisfied. The root cause of BatBadBut is the overlooked behavior of the CreateProcess function on Windows. When executing batch files with the CreateProcess function, Windows implicitly spawns cmd.exe because Windows canât execute batch files without it. ð https://flatt.tech/research/posts/batbadbut-you-cant-securely-execute-commands-on-windows/ https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/123335

#CVE_2024_22423 #CVE_2024_3566 #CVE_2024_24576 #CVE_2024_1874

##

CVE-2024-26816(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-10T15:30:50

2 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: x86, relocs: Ignore relocations in .notes section When building with CONFIG_XEN_PV=y, .text symbols are emitted into the .notes section so that Xen can find the "startup_xen" entry point. This information is used prior to booting the kernel, so relocations are not useful. In fact, performing relocations against the .notes sectio

cR0w at 2024-04-11T14:50:04.537Z ##

CVE-2024-26816 looks like a fun one: https://lore.kernel.org/linux-cve-announce/2024041039-CVE-2024-26816-5054@gregkh/T/

https://lore.kernel.org/all/202402180028.6DB512C50@keescook/

##
cR0w@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-11T14:50:04.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-31492
(8.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-10T15:30:50

2 posts

An external control of file name or path vulnerability [CWE-73] in FortiClientMac version 7.2.3 and below, version 7.0.10 and below installer may allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code or commands via writing a malicious configuration file in /tmp before starting the installation process.

simontsui at 2024-04-09T14:51:03.402Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from your friends at Fortinet. 13 security advisories, 15 vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation in the wild:

  • FG-IR-23-087 CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical) [FortiClient Linux] Remote Code Execution due to dangerous nodejs configuration
  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure
  • FG-IR-23-493 CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) FortiOS & FortiProxy - administrator cookie leakage
  • FG-IR-23-454 CVE-2024-23671 (8.1 high) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file delete on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-060 CVE-2024-31487 (5.9 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file read on endpoint
  • FG-IR-23-416 CVE-2023-47541 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file write on CLI leading to arbitrary code execution
  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-489 CVE-2024-21755 and CVE-2024-21756 (8.8 high) FortiSandbox - OS command injection on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

#PatchTuesday #Fortinet #FortiManager #vulnerability #FortiSandbox #FortiOS #FortiProxy

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-09T14:51:03.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from your friends at Fortinet. 13 security advisories, 15 vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation in the wild:

  • FG-IR-23-087 CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical) [FortiClient Linux] Remote Code Execution due to dangerous nodejs configuration
  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure
  • FG-IR-23-493 CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) FortiOS & FortiProxy - administrator cookie leakage
  • FG-IR-23-454 CVE-2024-23671 (8.1 high) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file delete on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-060 CVE-2024-31487 (5.9 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file read on endpoint
  • FG-IR-23-416 CVE-2023-47541 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file write on CLI leading to arbitrary code execution
  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-489 CVE-2024-21755 and CVE-2024-21756 (8.8 high) FortiSandbox - OS command injection on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

CVE-2023-6317
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-10T13:24:22.187000

5 posts

A prompt bypass exists in the secondscreen.gateway service running on webOS version 4 through 7. An attacker can create a privileged account without asking the user for the security PIN.Â  Full versions and TV models affected: webOS 4.9.7 - 5.30.40 running on LG43UM7000PLA webOS 5.5.0 - 04.50.51 running on OLED55CXPUA webOS 6.3.3-442 (kisscurl-kinglake) - 03.36.50 running on OLED48C1PUB Â  webOS

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-04-10T07:00:06.000Z ##

Critical Alert: LG WebOS Vulnerabilities Put Smart TV Users at Risk https://thecyberexpress.com/lg-webos-vulnerabilities/ #LGsmartTVvulnerabilities #LGWebOSvulnerabilities #TheCyberExpressNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20236317 #CVE20236318 #CVE20236319 #CVE20236320

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T15:40:03.580Z ##

Bitdefender disclosed 4 vulnerabilities in LG WebOS TV operating system. These are affecting WebOS versions 4 through 7 running on LG TVs. These vulnerabilities allow for root access on the TV after bypassing the authorization mechanism. No mention of exploitation, but Shodan search identified 91,000 devices exposing the vulnerable service to the internet. ð https://www.bitdefender.com/blog/labs/vulnerabilities-identified-in-lg-webos/

  • CVE-2023-6317 (7.2 high) prompt bypass to privileged account creation
  • CVE-2023-6318 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6319 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6320 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability

#vulnerability #lg #webos #CVE_2023_6317 #CVE_2023_6318 #CVE_2023_6319 #CVE_2023_6320

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-09T15:40:03.000Z ##

Bitdefender disclosed 4 vulnerabilities in LG WebOS TV operating system. These are affecting WebOS versions 4 through 7 running on LG TVs. These vulnerabilities allow for root access on the TV after bypassing the authorization mechanism. No mention of exploitation, but Shodan search identified 91,000 devices exposing the vulnerable service to the internet. ð https://www.bitdefender.com/blog/labs/vulnerabilities-identified-in-lg-webos/

  • CVE-2023-6317 (7.2 high) prompt bypass to privileged account creation
  • CVE-2023-6318 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6319 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6320 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability

##
avoidthehack at 2024-04-10T19:04:14.081Z ##

Thousands of #LG TVs are vulnerable to takeoverâhereâs how to ensure yours isnât one

Some LG Smart TVs expose a vulnerable service to the internet (as opposed to the LAN), which can be exploited by threat actors. No evidence of active exploitation that I know of.

Related CVEs:
CVE-2023-6317
CVE-2023-6318
CVE-2023-6319
CVE-2023-6320

Affected models:
LG43UM7000PLA running webOS 4.9.7 - 5.30.40
OLED55CXPUA running webOS 5.5.0 - 04.50.51
OLED48C1PUB running webOS 6.3.3-442 (kisscurl-kinglake) - 03.36.50
OLED55A23LA running webOS 7.3.1-43 (mullet-mebin) - 03.33.85

#Updates are available that fix these vulnerabilities.

#cve #exploits #cybersecurity #security

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/04/patches-released-for-as-many-as-91000-hackable-lg-tvs-exposed-to-the-internet/

##

CVE-2023-6318
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-10T13:24:22.187000

5 posts

A command injection vulnerability exists in the processAnalyticsReportÂ method from the com.webos.service.clouduploadÂ service on webOS version 5 through 7. A series of specially crafted requests can lead to command execution as the root user. An attacker can make authenticated requests to trigger this vulnerability. Full versions and TV models affected: * webOS 5.5.0 - 04.50.51 running on OLED

##

CVE-2024-29053
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:37

4 posts

Microsoft Defender for IoT Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-04-12T01:16:14.112Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) suspiciously updated four security advisories from this week:

  • CVE-2024-26234 (Proxy Driver Spoofing Vulnerability, 6.7 medium, previously updated to confirm that it was an exploited zero-day): added acknowledgements
  • CVE-2024-29053 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, 8.8 high): Added FAQ
  • CVE-2024-29054 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, 7.2 high): Added FAQ
  • CVE-2024-29055 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, 7.2 high): Added FAQ

Enough information in CVE-2024-29053's FAQ is provided to potentially develop an exploit without relying on a patch diffing. 29054 and 29055 are identical FAQs.

#CVE_2024_26234 #CVE_2024_29053 #CVE_2024_29054 #CVE_2024_29055 #vulnerability #Microsoft #MSRC #PatchTuesday

##

  • CVE-2024-29053 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, 8.8 high): Added FAQ

  • CVE-2024-29055 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, 7.2 high): Added FAQ

CVE-2024-29990
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:28

1 posts

Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service Confidential Container Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-04-09T19:05:03.000Z ##

CVE-2024-29988
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:28

5 posts

SmartScreen Prompt Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/AlexDoe11/CVE-2024-29988-MS-Exchange-RCE

avoidthehack at 2024-04-10T14:38:12.636Z ##

#Microsoft fixes two #Windows zero-days exploited in #malware attacks

Yesterday was patch tuesday. Among the ~150 #security patches released by Microsoft, Microsoft fixed 2 exploited 0-day vulnerabilities:

CVE-2024-26234 - a proxy driver spoofing #vulnerability
CVE-2024-29988 - security feature bypass (in SmartScreen), a workaround for the partial fix for CVE-2024-21412

Update ASAP.

@simontsui

#cve #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-fixes-two-windows-zero-days-exploited-in-malware-attacks/

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T22:15:51.020Z ##

@TheDustinChilds of Zero Day Initiative alleges that CVE-2024-29988 (8.8 high) was also exploited in the wild and should be marked an exploited zero-day ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/4/9/the-april-2024-security-updates-review

This is an odd one, as a ZDI threat researcher found this vulnerability being in the wild, although Microsoft currently doesnât list this as exploited. I would treat this as in the wild until Microsoft clarifies. The bug itself acts much like CVE-2024-21412 â it bypasses the Mark of the Web (MotW) feature and allows malware to execute on a target system. Threat actors are sending exploits in a zipped file to evade EDR/NDR detection and then using this bug (and others) to bypass MotW.

cc:@todb

#zeorday #CVE_2024_29988 #PatchTuesday #Microsoft #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #motw

CVE-2024-26234
(6.7 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:26

17 posts

Proxy Driver Spoofing Vulnerability

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-04-10T14:35:04.000Z ##

A tumultuous, titanic Patch Tuesday as Microsoft makes some changes â Source: news.sophos.com https://ciso2ciso.com/a-tumultuous-titanic-patch-tuesday-as-microsoft-makes-some-changes-source-news-sophos-com/ #rssfeedpostgeneratorecho #CyberSecurityNews #ThreatResearch #nakedsecurity #nakedsecurity #PatchTuesday #CVE202426234 #SecureBoot #BitLocker #drivers

##
simontsui at 2024-04-12T01:16:14.112Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) suspiciously updated four security advisories from this week:

  • CVE-2024-26234 (Proxy Driver Spoofing Vulnerability, 6.7 medium, previously updated to confirm that it was an exploited zero-day): added acknowledgements
  • CVE-2024-29053 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, 8.8 high): Added FAQ
  • CVE-2024-29054 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, 7.2 high): Added FAQ
  • CVE-2024-29055 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, 7.2 high): Added FAQ

Enough information in CVE-2024-29053's FAQ is provided to potentially develop an exploit without relying on a patch diffing. 29054 and 29055 are identical FAQs.

#CVE_2024_26234 #CVE_2024_29053 #CVE_2024_29054 #CVE_2024_29055 #vulnerability #Microsoft #MSRC #PatchTuesday

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T21:05:14.253Z ##

@jullrich of SANS ISC is on top of the new information from Sophos, and correctly identifies CVE-2024-26234 as an exploited zero-day in the Patch Tuesday summary. ð https://isc.sans.edu/diary/rss/30822

#PatchTuesday #CVE_2024_26234 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T20:36:39.308Z ##

Sophos X-Ops reported a backdoored "LaiXi Android Screen Mirroring" installer that they discovered in December 2023 was signed with a valid Microsoft Hardware Publisher Certificate. The campaign (unidentified threat actor) has been in development since at least January 2023. The incident was reported to Microsoft is tracked as CVE-2024-26234, and is the lone exploited zero-day for April 2024's Patch Tuesday! IOC provided. ð https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2024/04/09/smoke-and-screen-mirrors-a-strange-signed-backdoor/

#threatintel #IOC #backdoor #LaiXi #backdoor #CVE_2024_26234 #eitw #activeexploitation

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T17:07:35.197Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from Microsoft: 155 vulnerabilities.
EDIT: 1 vulnerability was updated to say Exploited and Publicly Disclosed: CVE-2024-26234 (6.7 medium) THIS IS AN EXPLOITED ZERO-DAY! See Sophos article for information on a malicious executable signed by a valid Microsoft Hardware Publisher Certificate: https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2024/04/09/smoke-and-screen-mirrors-a-strange-signed-backdoor/

Updated CVE to correct exploit status. This is an informational update only.

cc: @campuscodi @briankrebs @todb @serghei

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-12T01:16:14.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) suspiciously updated four security advisories from this week:

  • CVE-2024-26234 (Proxy Driver Spoofing Vulnerability, 6.7 medium, previously updated to confirm that it was an exploited zero-day): added acknowledgements
  • CVE-2024-29053 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, 8.8 high): Added FAQ
  • CVE-2024-29054 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, 7.2 high): Added FAQ
  • CVE-2024-29055 (Microsoft Defender for IoT Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability, 7.2 high): Added FAQ

Enough information in CVE-2024-29053's FAQ is provided to potentially develop an exploit without relying on a patch diffing. 29054 and 29055 are identical FAQs.

avoidthehack at 2024-04-10T14:38:12.636Z ##

#Microsoft fixes two #Windows zero-days exploited in #malware attacks

Yesterday was patch tuesday. Among the ~150 #security patches released by Microsoft, Microsoft fixed 2 exploited 0-day vulnerabilities:

CVE-2024-26234 - a proxy driver spoofing #vulnerability
CVE-2024-29988 - security feature bypass (in SmartScreen), a workaround for the partial fix for CVE-2024-21412

Update ASAP.

@simontsui

#cve #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-fixes-two-windows-zero-days-exploited-in-malware-attacks/

##
nflnfl at 2024-04-10T12:36:29.690Z ##

@hackingump1 Does CVE-2024-26234 simply mean that Microsoft signed something it shouldn't have signed, or is it something else?

##
SophosXOps at 2024-04-10T09:09:33.977Z ##

There are several notable themes to this very large collection of CVEs, including 41 patches related to SQL Server and 27 affecting startup tech such as BitLocker and Secure Boot, but Sophos itself has a featured role in this release: Labs' own Andreas Klopsch (@hackingump1) is the credited finder on CVE-2024-26234. (He's written about it in depth in a post also released on Tuesday, "Smoke and [screen] mirrors: A strange signed backdoor.")

https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2024/04/09/smoke-and-screen-mirrors-a-strange-signed-backdoor/

##
TheDustinChilds at 2024-04-09T23:04:13.453Z ##

It seems @msftsecresponse has confirmed another CVE is under active attack. CVE-2024-26234 report by my old colleague Christopher Budd at Sophos is publicly known and under attack. I've updated my blog to reflect this information. https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/4/9/the-april-2024-security-updates-review

##
SophosXOps@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-10T09:09:33.000Z ##

There are several notable themes to this very large collection of CVEs, including 41 patches related to SQL Server and 27 affecting startup tech such as BitLocker and Secure Boot, but Sophos itself has a featured role in this release: Labs' own Andreas Klopsch (@hackingump1) is the credited finder on CVE-2024-26234. (He's written about it in depth in a post also released on Tuesday, "Smoke and [screen] mirrors: A strange signed backdoor.")

https://news.sophos.com/en-us/2024/04/09/smoke-and-screen-mirrors-a-strange-signed-backdoor/

CVE-2024-29049
(4.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T18:30:22

2 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Webview2 Spoofing Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-04-05T00:37:51.574Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published security advisories that follow the Google Chrome blog post (check original toot above this reply)

  • CVE-2024-3156 Chromium: CVE-2024-3156 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-3158 Chromium: CVE-2024-3158 Use after free in Bookmarks
  • CVE-2024-3159 Chromium: CVE-2024-3159 Out of bounds memory access in V8 New
  • CVE-2024-29981 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability New!
  • CVE-2024-29049 (4.1 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Webview2 Spoofing Vulnerability New!

The last two are marked Not Exploited, Not Publicly Disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

##

CVE-2023-6320
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T15:30:44

5 posts

A command injection vulnerability exists in the com.webos.service.connectionmanager/tv/setVlanStaticAddress endpoint on webOS versions 5 and 6. A series of specially crafted requests can lead to command execution as the dbus user. An attacker can make authenticated requests to trigger this vulnerability. Full versions and TV models affected: * webOS 5.5.0 - 04.50.51 running on OLED55CXPUAÂ 

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-04-10T07:00:06.000Z ##

Critical Alert: LG WebOS Vulnerabilities Put Smart TV Users at Risk https://thecyberexpress.com/lg-webos-vulnerabilities/ #LGsmartTVvulnerabilities #LGWebOSvulnerabilities #TheCyberExpressNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20236317 #CVE20236318 #CVE20236319 #CVE20236320

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T15:40:03.580Z ##

Bitdefender disclosed 4 vulnerabilities in LG WebOS TV operating system. These are affecting WebOS versions 4 through 7 running on LG TVs. These vulnerabilities allow for root access on the TV after bypassing the authorization mechanism. No mention of exploitation, but Shodan search identified 91,000 devices exposing the vulnerable service to the internet. ð https://www.bitdefender.com/blog/labs/vulnerabilities-identified-in-lg-webos/

  • CVE-2023-6317 (7.2 high) prompt bypass to privileged account creation
  • CVE-2023-6318 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6319 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6320 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability

#vulnerability #lg #webos #CVE_2023_6317 #CVE_2023_6318 #CVE_2023_6319 #CVE_2023_6320

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-09T15:40:03.000Z ##

Bitdefender disclosed 4 vulnerabilities in LG WebOS TV operating system. These are affecting WebOS versions 4 through 7 running on LG TVs. These vulnerabilities allow for root access on the TV after bypassing the authorization mechanism. No mention of exploitation, but Shodan search identified 91,000 devices exposing the vulnerable service to the internet. ð https://www.bitdefender.com/blog/labs/vulnerabilities-identified-in-lg-webos/

  • CVE-2023-6317 (7.2 high) prompt bypass to privileged account creation
  • CVE-2023-6318 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6319 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6320 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability

#vulnerability #lg #webos #CVE_2023_6317 #CVE_2023_6318 #CVE_2023_6319 #CVE_2023_6320

##
avoidthehack at 2024-04-10T19:04:14.081Z ##

Thousands of #LG TVs are vulnerable to takeoverâhereâs how to ensure yours isnât one

Some LG Smart TVs expose a vulnerable service to the internet (as opposed to the LAN), which can be exploited by threat actors. No evidence of active exploitation that I know of.

Related CVEs:
CVE-2023-6317
CVE-2023-6318
CVE-2023-6319
CVE-2023-6320

Affected models:
LG43UM7000PLA running webOS 4.9.7 - 5.30.40
OLED55CXPUA running webOS 5.5.0 - 04.50.51
OLED48C1PUB running webOS 6.3.3-442 (kisscurl-kinglake) - 03.36.50
OLED55A23LA running webOS 7.3.1-43 (mullet-mebin) - 03.33.85

#Updates are available that fix these vulnerabilities.

#cve #exploits #cybersecurity #security

https://arstechnica.com/security/2024/04/patches-released-for-as-many-as-91000-hackable-lg-tvs-exposed-to-the-internet/

##

CVE-2023-41677
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T15:30:44

4 posts

A insufficiently protected credentials in Fortinet FortiProxy 7.4.0, 7.2.0 through 7.2.6, 7.0.0 through 7.0.12, 2.0.0 through 2.0.13, 1.2.0 through 1.2.13, 1.1.0 through 1.1.6, 1.0.0 through 1.0.7, Fortinet FortiOS 7.4.0 through 7.4.1, 7.2.0 through 7.2.6, 7.0.0 through 7.0.12, 6.4.0 through 6.4.14, 6.2.0 through 6.2.15, 6.0.0 through 6.0.17 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands

h4sh at 2024-04-09T21:45:11.466Z ##

Worth mentioning that despite the high average CVSS score and scary looking bugs on this #fortinet patch Tuesday, no bugs in that batch fit into the server side unauthenticated mass exploitation category, meaning its unlikely we'll see in the wild exploitation for ransomware deployments.

The worse two imo is the admin cookie leak CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) and FortiClient Linux CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical), but both require rare conditions (tricking user to page) and user interaction. So I guess be on the look out for fortinet-related phishing emails.

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T14:51:03.402Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from your friends at Fortinet. 13 security advisories, 15 vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation in the wild:

  • FG-IR-23-087 CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical) [FortiClient Linux] Remote Code Execution due to dangerous nodejs configuration
  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure
  • FG-IR-23-493 CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) FortiOS & FortiProxy - administrator cookie leakage
  • FG-IR-23-454 CVE-2024-23671 (8.1 high) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file delete on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-060 CVE-2024-31487 (5.9 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file read on endpoint
  • FG-IR-23-416 CVE-2023-47541 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file write on CLI leading to arbitrary code execution
  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-489 CVE-2024-21755 and CVE-2024-21756 (8.8 high) FortiSandbox - OS command injection on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

#PatchTuesday #Fortinet #FortiManager #vulnerability #FortiSandbox #FortiOS #FortiProxy

##
h4sh@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-09T21:45:11.000Z ##

Worth mentioning that despite the high average CVSS score and scary looking bugs on this #fortinet patch Tuesday, no bugs in that batch fit into the server side unauthenticated mass exploitation category, meaning its unlikely we'll see in the wild exploitation for ransomware deployments.

The worse two imo is the admin cookie leak CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) and FortiClient Linux CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical), but both require rare conditions (tricking user to page) and user interaction. So I guess be on the look out for fortinet-related phishing emails.

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-09T14:51:03.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from your friends at Fortinet. 13 security advisories, 15 vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation in the wild:

  • FG-IR-23-087 CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical) [FortiClient Linux] Remote Code Execution due to dangerous nodejs configuration
  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure
  • FG-IR-23-493 CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) FortiOS & FortiProxy - administrator cookie leakage

##

CVE-2023-45590
(9.7 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T15:30:44

4 posts

An improper control of generation of code ('code injection') in Fortinet FortiClientLinux version 7.2.0, 7.0.6 through 7.0.10 and 7.0.3 through 7.0.4 allows attacker to execute unauthorized code or commands via tricking a FortiClientLinux user into visiting a malicious website

h4sh at 2024-04-09T21:45:11.466Z ##

Worth mentioning that despite the high average CVSS score and scary looking bugs on this #fortinet patch Tuesday, no bugs in that batch fit into the server side unauthenticated mass exploitation category, meaning its unlikely we'll see in the wild exploitation for ransomware deployments.

The worse two imo is the admin cookie leak CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) and FortiClient Linux CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical), but both require rare conditions (tricking user to page) and user interaction. So I guess be on the look out for fortinet-related phishing emails.

  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command

  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

##

CVE-2023-6319
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T15:30:43

5 posts

A command injection vulnerability exists in the getAudioMetadataÂ method from the com.webos.service.attachedstoragemanager service on webOS version 4 through 7. A series of specially crafted requests can lead to command execution as the root user. An attacker can make authenticated requests to trigger this vulnerability. * webOS 4.9.7 - 5.30.40 running on LG43UM7000PLAÂ  * webOS 5.5.0 - 04.5

1 repos

https://github.com/illixion/root-my-webos-tv

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-04-10T07:00:06.000Z ##

Critical Alert: LG WebOS Vulnerabilities Put Smart TV Users at Risk https://thecyberexpress.com/lg-webos-vulnerabilities/ #LGsmartTVvulnerabilities #LGWebOSvulnerabilities #TheCyberExpressNews #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #CVE20236317 #CVE20236318 #CVE20236319 #CVE20236320

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T15:40:03.580Z ##

Bitdefender disclosed 4 vulnerabilities in LG WebOS TV operating system. These are affecting WebOS versions 4 through 7 running on LG TVs. These vulnerabilities allow for root access on the TV after bypassing the authorization mechanism. No mention of exploitation, but Shodan search identified 91,000 devices exposing the vulnerable service to the internet. ð https://www.bitdefender.com/blog/labs/vulnerabilities-identified-in-lg-webos/

  • CVE-2023-6317 (7.2 high) prompt bypass to privileged account creation
  • CVE-2023-6318 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6319 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability
  • CVE-2023-6320 (9.1 critical) command injection vulnerability

#vulnerability #lg #webos #CVE_2023_6317 #CVE_2023_6318 #CVE_2023_6319 #CVE_2023_6320

##
avoidthehack at 2024-04-10T19:04:14.081Z ##

Thousands of #LG TVs are vulnerable to takeoverâhereâs how to ensure yours isnât one

Some LG Smart TVs expose a vulnerable service to the internet (as opposed to the LAN), which can be exploited by threat actors. No evidence of active exploitation that I know of.

Related CVEs:
CVE-2023-6317
CVE-2023-6318
CVE-2023-6319
CVE-2023-6320

Affected models:
LG43UM7000PLA running webOS 4.9.7 - 5.30.40
OLED55CXPUA running webOS 5.5.0 - 04.50.51
OLED48C1PUB running webOS 6.3.3-442 (kisscurl-kinglake) - 03.36.50
OLED55A23LA running webOS 7.3.1-43 (mullet-mebin) - 03.33.85

#Updates are available that fix these vulnerabilities.

#cve #exploits #cybersecurity #security

  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-489 CVE-2024-21755 and CVE-2024-21756 (8.8 high) FortiSandbox - OS command injection on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

#PatchTuesday #Fortinet #FortiManager #vulnerability #FortiSandbox #FortiOS #FortiProxy

##

CVE-2024-27983
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T03:30:53

7 posts

An attacker can make the Node.js HTTP/2 server completely unavailable by sending a small amount of HTTP/2 frames packets with a few HTTP/2 frames inside. It is possible to leave some data in nghttp2 memory after reset when headers with HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frame are sent to the server and then a TCP connection is abruptly closed by the client triggering the Http2Session destructor while header fram

1 repos

https://github.com/lirantal/CVE-2024-27983-nodejs-http2

adamw@fosstodon.org at 2024-04-11T06:29:47.000Z ##

today:
* research on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272758 to help blocker determination at #fedora 40 go/no-go tomorrow
* research on CVE-2024-2201 to determine whether we need to block on it (probably not)
* ditto CVE-2024-27983
* testing on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272971
* final check and merge of https://pagure.io/fedora-qa/os-autoinst-distri-fedora/pull-request/304
* wrote a little script for releng to try and avoid mistakes in pungi config updates for f41+ - https://pagure.io/pungi-fedora/pull-request/1276
* updated bodhi PR to fill out the test coverage - https://github.com/fedora-infra/bodhi/pull/5630

##
catsalad at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.371Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http
â ï¸â CVE-2024-28182 â nghttp2 library
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27316 â Apache Httpd
â ï¸â CVE-2024-31309 â Apache Traffic Server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

â¸»
#InfoSec #CyberSecurity #CVE #DoS #HTTP2 #Vulnerability #ï¸â£CatSalad

##
simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:41:52.654Z ##

CERT/CC security advisory: HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames can be utilized for DoS attacks ð https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

  • CVE-2024-27983 (high severity) Node.js DoS
  • CVE-2024-2653 (8.2 high) amphp/http DoS
  • CVE-2024-27316 (unknown) Apache HTTP Server (httpd) DoS
  • CVE-2024-24549 (unknown) Apache Tomcat DoS
  • CVE-2024-31309 (unknown) Apache Traffic Server
  • CVE-2024-27919 (7.5 high) Envoy proxy (oghttp) DoS
  • CVE-2024-30255 (5.3 medium) Envoy proxy (nghttp2) DoS
  • CVE-2023-45288 GoLang DoS (analyst note: GoLang mistakenly used a 2023 CVE ID)
  • CVE-2024-28182 (unknown) nghttp2 DoS
  • CVE-2024-2758 (unknown) Tempesta FTW DoS

#DoS #HTTP2 #CONTINUATION

catsalad@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.000Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http

â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

CVE-2024-22052
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-09T00:30:41

7 posts

A null pointer dereference vulnerability in IPSec component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure allows an unauthenticated malicious user to send specially crafted requests in-order-to crash the service thereby causing a DoS attack

CVE-2024-21894 and CVE-2024-22053 are heap overflows, in certain conditions allow remote code execution
(CVE-2024-21894) or reading of contents in memory (CVE-2024-22053)

  • CVE-2024-22052 (7.5 high) null pointer dereference causes DoS
  • CVE-2024-22053 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to DoS or information disclosure
  • CVE-2024-22023 (5.3 medium) XML entity expansion (XEE) causes a limited-time DoS

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by these vulnerabilities at the time of disclosure.

CVE-2024-3159(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-06T15:30:34

3 posts

Out of bounds memory access in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.105 allowed a remote attacker to perform arbitrary read/write via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-04-05T00:37:51.574Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published security advisories that follow the Google Chrome blog post (check original toot above this reply)

  • CVE-2024-3156 Chromium: CVE-2024-3156 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-3158 Chromium: CVE-2024-3158 Use after free in Bookmarks
  • CVE-2024-3159 Chromium: CVE-2024-3159 Out of bounds memory access in V8 New
  • CVE-2024-29981 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability New!
  • CVE-2024-29049 (4.1 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Webview2 Spoofing Vulnerability New!

The last two are marked Not Exploited, Not Publicly Disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T22:35:52.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 3 externally reported vulnerabilities, all high severity. No mention of exploitation in the wild: ð https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/04/stable-channel-update-for-desktop.html

  • CVE-2024-3156: Inappropriate implementation in V8.
  • CVE-2024-3158: Use after free in Bookmarks
  • CVE-2024-3159: Out of bounds memory access in V8. (demonstrated in Pwn2Own Vancouver 2024 on 22 March 2024 by Edouard Bochin (@le_douds) and Tao Yan (@Ga1ois) of Palo Alto Networks)

##

CVE-2024-3156(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-06T15:30:28

3 posts

Inappropriate implementation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 123.0.6312.105 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of bounds memory access via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

simontsui at 2024-04-05T00:37:51.574Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) published security advisories that follow the Google Chrome blog post (check original toot above this reply)

  • CVE-2024-3156 Chromium: CVE-2024-3156 Inappropriate implementation in V8
  • CVE-2024-3158 Chromium: CVE-2024-3158 Use after free in Bookmarks
  • CVE-2024-3159 Chromium: CVE-2024-3159 Out of bounds memory access in V8 New
  • CVE-2024-29981 (4.3 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Spoofing Vulnerability New!
  • CVE-2024-29049 (4.1 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Webview2 Spoofing Vulnerability New!

The last two are marked Not Exploited, Not Publicly Disclosed, and Exploitation Less Likely.

#MSRC #Microsoft #Chrome #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T22:35:52.000Z ##

Google Chrome security advisory: 3 externally reported vulnerabilities, all high severity. No mention of exploitation in the wild: ð https://chromereleases.googleblog.com/2024/04/stable-channel-update-for-desktop.html

  • CVE-2024-3156: Inappropriate implementation in V8.
  • CVE-2024-3158: Use after free in Bookmarks
  • CVE-2024-3159: Out of bounds memory access in V8. (demonstrated in Pwn2Own Vancouver 2024 on 22 March 2024 by Edouard Bochin (@le_douds) and Tao Yan (@Ga1ois) of Palo Alto Networks)

CVE-2024-25029
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-06T12:30:56

1 posts

IBM Personal Communications 14.0.6 through 15.0.1 includes a Windows service that is vulnerable to remote code execution (RCE) and local privilege escalation (LPE). The vulnerability allows any unprivileged user with network access to a target computer to run commands with full privileges in the context of NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM. This allows for a low privileged attacker to move laterally to affected

##

CVE-2024-1086
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-06T05:01:36

2 posts

A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tables component can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. The nft_verdict_init() function allows positive values as drop error within the hook verdict, and hence the nf_hook_slow() function can cause a double free vulnerability when NF_DROP is issued with a drop error which resembles NF_ACCEPT. We recommend upgradi

8 posts

A heap overflow vulnerability in IPSec component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure allows an unauthenticated malicious user to send specially crafted requests in-order-to crash the service thereby causing a DoS attack. (CVE-2024-21894) or reading of contents in memory (CVE-2024-22053)

I want to get off Mr. Ivanti's wild ride: security advisory for Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure: ð https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/SA-CVE-2024-21894-Heap-Overflow-CVE-2024-22052-Null-Pointer-Dereference-CVE-2024-22053-Heap-Overflow-and-CVE-2024-22023-XML-entity-expansion-or-XXE-for-Ivanti-Connect-Secure-and-Ivanti-Policy-Secure-Gateways and blog post: https://www.ivanti.com/blog/security-update-for-ivanti-connect-secure-and-policy-secure

  • CVE-2024-21894 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to Denial of Service (DoS), and sometimes arbitrary code execution
  • CVE-2024-22052 (7.5 high) null pointer dereference causes DoS
  • CVE-2024-22053 (8.2 high) heap overflow leads to DoS or information disclosure
  • CVE-2024-22023 (5.3 medium) XML entity expansion (XEE) causes a limited-time DoS

We are not aware of any customers being exploited by these vulnerabilities at the time of disclosure.

##

CVE-2023-45288
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T23:02:58

5 posts

An attacker may cause an HTTP/2 endpoint to read arbitrary amounts of header data by sending an excessive number of CONTINUATION frames. Maintaining HPACK state requires parsing and processing all HEADERS and CONTINUATION frames on a connection. When a request's headers exceed MaxHeaderBytes, no memory is allocated to store the excess headers, but they are still parsed. This permits an attacker to

1 repos

https://github.com/hex0punk/cont-flood-poc

catsalad at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.371Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http
â ï¸â CVE-2024-28182 â nghttp2 library
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27316 â Apache Httpd
â ï¸â CVE-2024-31309 â Apache Traffic Server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

â¸»
#InfoSec #CyberSecurity #CVE #DoS #HTTP2 #Vulnerability #ï¸â£CatSalad

simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:41:52.654Z ##

CERT/CC security advisory: HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames can be utilized for DoS attacks ð https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

  • CVE-2024-27983 (high severity) Node.js DoS
  • CVE-2024-2653 (8.2 high) amphp/http DoS
  • CVE-2024-27316 (unknown) Apache HTTP Server (httpd) DoS
  • CVE-2024-24549 (unknown) Apache Tomcat DoS
  • CVE-2024-31309 (unknown) Apache Traffic Server
  • CVE-2024-27919 (7.5 high) Envoy proxy (oghttp) DoS
  • CVE-2024-30255 (5.3 medium) Envoy proxy (nghttp2) DoS
  • CVE-2023-45288 GoLang DoS (analyst note: GoLang mistakenly used a 2023 CVE ID)
  • CVE-2024-28182 (unknown) nghttp2 DoS
  • CVE-2024-2758 (unknown) Tempesta FTW DoS

catsalad@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.000Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

##
TomSellers@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T12:46:01.000Z ##

The Go team is expecting to release Go 1.22.2 and Go 1.21.9 during US business hours on Wednesday, April 3. This is to release a security fix for a privately disclosed vulnerability labeled as CVE-2023-45288 There isn't more data about the vuln at this time.

https://groups.google.com/g/golang-announce/c/nUtcDA04HLM

It looks like this has been in the works for a bit since the CVE is from 2023 and an issue was opened in their public GH repo on Jan 10. It looked like they originally planned to backport it to 1.20 but missed the window.

https://github.com/golang/go/issues/65051

#Security #Go #Golang

##

CVE-2024-27316(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T21:30:43

4 posts

HTTP/2 incoming headers exceeding the limit are temporarily buffered in nghttp2 in order to generate an informative HTTP 413 response. If a client does not stop sending headers, this leads to memory exhaustion.

1 repos

https://github.com/lockness-Ko/CVE-2024-27316

catsalad at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.371Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http
â ï¸â CVE-2024-28182 â nghttp2 library
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27316 â Apache Httpd
â ï¸â CVE-2024-31309 â Apache Traffic Server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

â¸»
#InfoSec #CyberSecurity #CVE #DoS #HTTP2 #Vulnerability #ï¸â£CatSalad

##
simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:41:52.654Z ##

CERT/CC security advisory: HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames can be utilized for DoS attacks ð https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

  • CVE-2024-27983 (high severity) Node.js DoS
  • CVE-2024-2653 (8.2 high) amphp/http DoS
  • CVE-2024-27316 (unknown) Apache HTTP Server (httpd) DoS
  • CVE-2024-24549 (unknown) Apache Tomcat DoS
  • CVE-2024-31309 (unknown) Apache Traffic Server
  • CVE-2024-27919 (7.5 high) Envoy proxy (oghttp) DoS
  • CVE-2024-30255 (5.3 medium) Envoy proxy (nghttp2) DoS
  • CVE-2023-45288 GoLang DoS (analyst note: GoLang mistakenly used a 2023 CVE ID)
  • CVE-2024-28182 (unknown) nghttp2 DoS
  • CVE-2024-2758 (unknown) Tempesta FTW DoS

#DoS #HTTP2 #CONTINUATION

##
catsalad@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.000Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http
â ï¸â CVE-2024-28182 â nghttp2 library
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27316 â Apache Httpd
â ï¸â CVE-2024-31309 â Apache Traffic Server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

â¸»

  • CVE-2024-2653 (8.2 high) amphp/http DoS

##

CVE-2024-22053
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T21:30:31

7 posts

A heap overflow vulnerability in IPSec component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure allows an unauthenticated malicious user to send specially crafted requests in-order-to crash the service thereby causing a DoS attack or in certain conditions read contents from memory.

decio at 2024-04-04T08:07:54.521Z ##

#Ivanti a dÃ©couvert des vulnÃ©rabilitÃ©s dans ses produits Connect Secure et Policy Secure, touchant les versions 9.x et 22.x. Un patch est dÃ©sormais disponible. Ces failles, si exploitÃ©es, pourraient permettre des attaques de dÃ©ni de service ou, dans certains cas, l'exÃ©cution de code arbitraire. Ivanti conseille vivement d'appliquer les correctifs disponibles via le portail de tÃ©lÃ©chargement

CVE-2024-21894 and CVE-2024-22053 are heap overflows, in certain conditions allow remote code execution
(CVE-2024-21894) or reading of contents in memory (CVE-2024-22053)

##

CVE-2024-22023
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-04T21:30:30

7 posts

An XML entity expansion or XEE vulnerability in SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure allows an unauthenticated attacker to send specially crafted XML requests in-order-to temporarily cause resource exhaustion thereby resulting in a limited-time DoS.

(8.6 HIGH)

updated 2024-04-04T18:30:36

2 posts

simontsui at 2024-04-05T14:56:18.355Z ##

No mention of exploitation in the wild. ð https://support.broadcom.com/web/ecx/support-content-notification/-/external/content/SecurityAdvisories/0/23215

CVE-2023-43777
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-04-04T08:43:10

1 posts

Eaton easySoft software is used to program easy controllers and displays for configuring, programming and defining parameters for all the intelligent relays. This software has a password protection functionality to secure the project file from unauthorized access. This password was being stored insecurely and could be retrieved by skilled adversaries.Â 

deeg@mastodon.social at 2024-04-08T13:31:26.000Z ##

I've just published an edited version of the SySS PoC video concerning the two already fixed security vulnerabilities SYSS-2023-007 (CVE-2023-43777) and SYSS-2023-008 (CVE-2023-43776) affecting the Eaton easyE4 PLC.

https://youtu.be/j3Pktskzqzw

#itsecurity #cybersecurity #plc

CVE-2023-43776
(6.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-04-04T08:43:10

1 posts

Eaton easyE4 PLC offers a device password protection functionality to facilitate a secure connection and prevent unauthorized access. It was observed that the device password was stored with a weak encoding algorithm in the easyE4 program file when exported to SD card (*.PRG file ending).

rye at 2024-04-03T02:49:14.448Z ##

First, you'll don the armor of WinRAR, not to defend against the xz backdoors, but to shield yourself from the icy chill of CVE-2023-38831, a vulnerability that lurks in the shadows, waiting to exploit the trusting user.

Next, you'll don the cloak of PKZip, a tool as ancient as time itself, but with a purpose as sharp as a dagger. It's not just for show; it's your shield against the CVE-2023-38831, a vulnerability that, despite its age, still poses a threat to the unsuspecting.

Then, you'll don the helmet of gzip, a warrior of the digital realm, ready to face the zip-slip, a sneaky little bug that lurks within PKZip's archives, waiting to strike. With gzip, you'll stand your ground, ready to defend against this sneaky attack.

Finally, you'll don the boots of 7zip, a guardian of the digital fortress, your last line of defense against the ever-evolving threats of the digital world, including the notorious CVE-2022-1271, a vulnerability that has been whispered about in the darkest corners of the internet.

So, my dear, prepare yourself for a journey of endless clicking, a testament to your resolve and your commitment to digital security. Just keep clicking, and perhaps, one day, you'll find the document you seek, unscathed and ready to be opened.

##

CVE-2019-5010
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.85%

updated 2024-04-04T02:38:18

1 posts

An exploitable denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the X509 certificate parser of Python.org Python 2.7.11 / 3.6.6. A specially crafted X509 certificate can cause a NULL pointer dereference, resulting in a denial of service. An attacker can initiate or accept TLS connections using crafted certificates to trigger this vulnerability.

1 repos

https://github.com/JonathanWilbur/CVE-2019-5010

rotan@mastodon.ie at 2024-04-02T23:14:06.000Z ##

@terri

Funny! Though just because Python is relatively safe from that kind of trip hazard, the runtime might not be, as lessons from CVE-2019-5010 demonstrate.

Good luck weeding out the AI nonsense.

##

CVE-2024-2653
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-03T18:54:55

4 posts

`amphp/http` will collect HTTP/2 `CONTINUATION` frames in an unbounded buffer and will not check the header size limit until it has received the `END_HEADERS` flag, resulting in an OOM crash. `amphp/http-client` and `amphp/http-server` are indirectly affected if they're used with an unpatched version of `amphp/http`. Early versions of `amphp/http-client` with HTTP/2 support (v4.0.0-rc10 to 4.0.0)

3 repos

https://github.com/sajaljat/CVE-2024-26535

https://github.com/lockness-Ko/CVE-2024-27316

https://github.com/sajaljat/CVE-2024-26534

catsalad at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.371Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http
â ï¸â CVE-2024-28182 â nghttp2 library
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27316 â Apache Httpd
â ï¸â CVE-2024-31309 â Apache Traffic Server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

â¸»
#InfoSec #CyberSecurity #CVE #DoS #HTTP2 #Vulnerability #ï¸â£CatSalad

##
simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:41:52.654Z ##

CERT/CC security advisory: HTTP/2 CONTINUATION frames can be utilized for DoS attacks ð https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

  • CVE-2024-27983 (high severity) Node.js DoS
  • CVE-2024-2653 (8.2 high) amphp/http DoS
  • CVE-2024-27316 (unknown) Apache HTTP Server (httpd) DoS
  • CVE-2024-24549 (unknown) Apache Tomcat DoS
  • CVE-2024-31309 (unknown) Apache Traffic Server
  • CVE-2024-27919 (7.5 high) Envoy proxy (oghttp) DoS
  • CVE-2024-30255 (5.3 medium) Envoy proxy (nghttp2) DoS
  • CVE-2023-45288 GoLang DoS (analyst note: GoLang mistakenly used a 2023 CVE ID)
  • CVE-2024-28182 (unknown) nghttp2 DoS
  • CVE-2024-2758 (unknown) Tempesta FTW DoS

#DoS #HTTP2 #CONTINUATION

##
catsalad@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.000Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http
â ï¸â CVE-2024-28182 â nghttp2 library
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27316 â Apache Httpd
â ï¸â CVE-2024-31309 â Apache Traffic Server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

â¸»
#InfoSec #CyberSecurity #CVE #DoS #HTTP2 #Vulnerability #ï¸â£CatSalad

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-04T14:41:52.000Z ##

  • CVE-2024-27983 (high severity) Node.js DoS
  • CVE-2024-2653 (8.2 high) amphp/http DoS
  • CVE-2024-27316 (unknown) Apache HTTP Server (httpd) DoS
  • CVE-2024-24549 (unknown) Apache Tomcat DoS
  • CVE-2024-31309 (unknown) Apache Traffic Server
  • CVE-2024-27919 (7.5 high) Envoy proxy (oghttp) DoS
  • CVE-2024-30255 (5.3 medium) Envoy proxy (nghttp2) DoS
  • CVE-2023-45288 GoLang DoS (analyst note: GoLang mistakenly used a 2023 CVE ID)
  • CVE-2024-28182 (unknown) nghttp2 DoS
  • CVE-2024-2758 (unknown) Tempesta FTW DoS

#DoS #HTTP2 #CONTINUATION

##

CVE-2024-2758(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-04-03T18:30:55

4 posts

Tempesta FW rate limits are not enabled by default. They are either set too large to capture empty CONTINUATION frames attacks or too small to handle normal HTTP requests appropriately.

catsalad at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.371Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

  • CVE-2024-20347, CVE-2024-20352 (4.9 medium) Cisco Emergency Responder Cross-Site Request Forgery and Directory Traversal Vulnerabilities
  • CVE-2024-20334 (5.5 medium) Cisco TelePresence Management Suite Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20362 (6.1 medium) Cisco Small Business RV016, RV042, RV042G, RV082, RV320, and RV325 Routers Cross-Site Scripting Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20282 (6.0 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-20302 (5.4 medium) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator Unauthorized Policy Actions Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-20348 (7.5 high) Cisco Nexus Dashboard Fabric Controller Plug and Play Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

CVE-2024-30370
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-04-02T21:30:37

1 posts

RARLAB WinRAR Mark-Of-The-Web Bypass Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-Of-The-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of RARLAB WinRAR. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must perform a specific action on a malicious page. The specific flaw exists within the archive extraction functionality. A crafted

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-01T19:12:51.000Z ##

Another Zero Day Initiative security advisory, since RARLAB failed to include the CVE ID in their release notes: CVE-2024-30370 (4.3 medium, CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N) RARLAB WinRAR Mark-Of-The-Web Bypass Vulnerability. I'm not a betting man, but I can see threat actors utilizing this quickly based on historical abuse. ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-357/ and https://www.rarlab.com/rarnew.htm#27.%20Busgs%20fixed

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to bypass the Mark-Of-The-Web protection mechanism on affected installations of RARLAB WinRAR. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must perform a specific action on a malicious page.

The specific flaw exists within the archive extraction functionality. A crafted archive entry can cause the creation of an arbitrary file without the Mark-Of-The-Web. An attacker can leverage this in conjunction with other vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user.

#CVE_2024_30370 #markoftheweb #WinRAR #vulnerability

campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-04-02T15:23:48.000Z ##

A security researcher has discovered a vulnerability (CVE-2023-50969) in Imperva SecureSphere firewalls.

The vulnerability allows attackers to manipulate HTTP headers and slip malicious payloads past the firewall.

Approximately 400 Imperva SecureSphere firewalls are currently exposed online. Imperva released a fix at the end of February.

https://www.hoyahaxa.com/2024/03/imperva-waf-bypass-cve-2023-50969.html

##

CVE-2024-31138
(4.6 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-03-28T15:30:44

1 posts

In JetBrains TeamCity before 2024.03 xSS was possible via Agent Distribution settings

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-01T19:00:56.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative security advisory reveals additional information on CVE-2024-31138 (4.6 medium, CVSSv3.1:AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:N) ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-24-360/

This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary script on affected installations of JetBrains TeamCity. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.

The specific flaw exists within the handling of the os parameter provided to the AgentDistributionSettingsController.doPost method. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can lead to the injection of arbitrary script. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute script in the context of the current user.

#JetBrains #TeamCity #vulnerability #CVE_2024_31138

##

CVE-2024-1580
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-03-27T18:32:38

1 posts

An integer overflow in dav1d AV1 decoder that can occur when decoding videos with large frame size. This can lead to memory corruption within the AV1 decoder. We recommend upgrading past version 1.4.0 of dav1d.

hsivonen@mastodon.social at 2024-04-13T10:16:58.000Z ##

Iâm still worried about the ecosystem effects of Apple not including Rust code in products that are distributed to end users. The most recent dot release of Appleâs operating systems fixed CVE-2024-1580, which was a bug in dav1d. Clearly, in terms of getting adoption, it has been strategically the right choice that dav1d uses C instead of Rust, and rav1d is an also-available port. However, weâd all be better off in a world where it would be strategically OK to write rav1d to begin with.

Moby is an open source container framework originally developed by Docker Inc. as Docker. It is a key component of Docker Engine, Docker Desktop, and other distributions of container tooling or runtimes. As a batteries-included container runtime, Moby comes with a built-in networking implementation that enables communication between containers, and between containers and external resources. Moby'

netzwerkgoettin@konfigurationsmanufaktur.de at 2024-04-04T14:55:03.000Z ##

Oh.

Das vermutlich.

"CVE-2024-29018: Do not forward requests to external DNS servers for a container that is only connected to an 'internal' network."

Update: das scheint dann auch auf Container zuzutreffen, die mit einem Bein in einem externen und mit dem anderen Bein in einem internen Netz stehen.

##
netzwerkgoettin@konfigurationsmanufaktur.de at 2024-04-04T14:55:03.000Z ##

Oh.

Das vermutlich.

"CVE-2024-29018: Do not forward requests to external DNS servers for a container that is only connected to an 'internal' network."

Update: das scheint dann auch auf Container zuzutreffen, die mit einem Bein in einem externen und mit dem anderen Bein in einem internen Netz stehen.

CVE-2022-48618
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.23%

updated 2024-03-10T05:00:57

1 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.1, watchOS 9.2, iOS 16.2 and iPadOS 16.2, tvOS 16.2. An attacker with arbitrary read and write capability may be able to bypass Pointer Authentication. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.1.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-03T18:26:36.000Z ##

@jgreig I've said this before about Apple quietly hiding an exploited zero-day vulnerability in a 2 year old security advisory, and the only reason we knew was from a government announcement, when CISA added CVE-2022-48618 to the KEV Catalog on 31 January 2024.

CVE-2024-20720
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-02-15T15:30:37

8 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.6-p3, 2.4.5-p5, 2.4.4-p6 and earlier are affected by an Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection') vulnerability that could lead in arbitrary code execution by an attacker. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction.

jbhall56 at 2024-04-07T20:07:28.720Z ##

The attack leverages CVE-2024-20720 (CVSS score: 9.1), which has been described by Adobe as a case of "improper neutralization of special elements" that could pave the way for arbitrary code execution. https://thehackernews.com/2024/04/hackers-exploit-magento-bug-to-steal.html

##
simontsui at 2024-04-06T13:24:24.356Z ##

Why you should care about the exploitation of CVE-2024-20720:
A similar Adobeâ¯Commerce andâ¯Magento Open Source vulnerability CVE-2022-24086 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Adobe as a zero-day; improper input validation) was "exploited in the wild in very limited attacks targeting Adobe Commerce merchants." CVE-2022-24086 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 15 February 2024, so there is a strong possibility that they would consider CVE-2024-20720. ð https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb22-12.html

#CVE_2024_20720 #Adobe #Commerce #Magento #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #IOC

##
simontsui at 2024-04-05T13:28:01.427Z ##

Sansec reports active exploitation of CVE-2024-20720 (9.1 critical, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Adobe; Adobe Commerce/Magento Open Source OS command injection) to inject a fake Stripe payment skimmer, which would copy payment data to a compromised Magento store. IOC provided. ð https://sansec.io/research/magento-xml-backdoor

#CVE_2024_20720 #Adobe #Commerce #Magento #eitw #threatintel #activeexploitation #IOC

##
campuscodi@mastodon.social at 2024-04-04T17:38:32.000Z ##

Sansec researchers have spotted a threat actor exploiting a Magento bug tracked as CVE-2024-20720 being abused in the wild for the first time to backdoor e-commerce sites.

https://sansec.io/research/magento-xml-backdoor

CVE-2024-21412
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.36%

updated 2024-02-13T18:38:32

4 posts

Internet Shortcut Files Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

1 repos

https://github.com/lsr00ter/CVE-2024-21412_Water-Hydra

avoidthehack at 2024-04-10T14:38:12.636Z ##

#Microsoft fixes two #Windows zero-days exploited in #malware attacks

Yesterday was patch tuesday. Among the ~150 #security patches released by Microsoft, Microsoft fixed 2 exploited 0-day vulnerabilities:

CVE-2024-26234 - a proxy driver spoofing #vulnerability
CVE-2024-29988 - security feature bypass (in SmartScreen), a workaround for the partial fix for CVE-2024-21412

Update ASAP.

@simontsui

#cve #cybersecurity

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/microsoft/microsoft-fixes-two-windows-zero-days-exploited-in-malware-attacks/

##
simontsui at 2024-04-09T22:15:51.020Z ##

@TheDustinChilds of Zero Day Initiative alleges that CVE-2024-29988 (8.8 high) was also exploited in the wild and should be marked an exploited zero-day ð https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/4/9/the-april-2024-security-updates-review

This is an odd one, as a ZDI threat researcher found this vulnerability being in the wild, although Microsoft currently doesnât list this as exploited. I would treat this as in the wild until Microsoft clarifies. The bug itself acts much like CVE-2024-21412 â it bypasses the Mark of the Web (MotW) feature and allows malware to execute on a target system. Threat actors are sending exploits in a zipped file to evade EDR/NDR detection and then using this bug (and others) to bypass MotW.

cc:@todb

#zeorday #CVE_2024_29988 #PatchTuesday #Microsoft #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #motw

I would treat this as in the wild until Microsoft clarifies. The bug itself acts much like CVE-2024-21412 â it bypasses the Mark of the Web (MotW) feature and allows malware to execute on a target system. CVE-2024-21893
(8.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 96.14%

updated 2024-02-09T05:11:32

4 posts

A server-side request forgery vulnerability in the SAML component of Ivanti Connect Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Policy Secure (9.x, 22.x) and Ivanti Neurons for ZTA allows an attacker to access certain restricted resources without authentication.

4 repos

https://github.com/Chocapikk/CVE-2024-21893-to-CVE-2024-21887

https://github.com/h4x0r-dz/CVE-2024-21893.py

https://github.com/gobysec/Goby

https://github.com/gobysec/GobyVuls

simontsui at 2024-04-09T15:06:39.987Z ##

Mandiant publicly discloses a Server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Apache XML Security for C++ library (xml-security-c), part of the Apache Santuario project. "As external URI resolution is a legitimate feature in the XML Digital Signature specification, the ASF did not issue a CVE or a new release of xml-security-c." While Mandiant warns of its similarity to CVE-2024-21893, this vulnerability is not currently being exploited in the wild. Mandiant provided their own patch. ð https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/apache-library-allows-server-side-request-forgery/

#SSRF #Apache #xml_security_c

##
simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:53:52.007Z ##

Mandiant releases part 4 of the Ivanti Connect Secure incident response investigation. They detail different types of post-exploitation activity across their IR engagements. Chinese threat actors have a growing knowledge of Ivanti Connect Secure in abusing appliance-specific functionality to perform actions on objective. They highlight FIVE Chinese threat actors: UNC5221, UNC5266, UNC5330, UNC5337, and UNC5291 abusing a mix of CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, and CVE-2024-21893. New TTPs, new malware families and new IOC: ð https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-post-exploitation-lateral-movement

EDIT: For your situational awareness, it's my understanding that future Mandiant articles will be located at https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-09T15:06:39.000Z ##

Mandiant publicly discloses a Server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Apache XML Security for C++ library (xml-security-c), part of the Apache Santuario project. "As external URI resolution is a legitimate feature in the XML Digital Signature specification, the ASF did not issue a CVE or a new release of xml-security-c." While Mandiant warns of its similarity to CVE-2024-21893, this vulnerability is not currently being exploited in the wild. Mandiant provided their own patch. ð https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/apache-library-allows-server-side-request-forgery/

#SSRF #Apache #xml_security_c

Chinese threat actors have a growing knowledge of Ivanti Connect Secure in abusing appliance-specific functionality to perform actions on objective. They highlight FIVE Chinese threat actors: UNC5221, UNC5266, UNC5330, UNC5337, and UNC5291 abusing a mix of CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, and CVE-2024-21893.
