simontsui at 2024-04-04T14:53:52.007Z ##

Mandiant releases part 4 of the Ivanti Connect Secure incident response investigation. They detail different types of post-exploitation activity across their IR engagements. Chinese threat actors have a growing knowledge of Ivanti Connect Secure in abusing appliance-specific functionality to perform actions on objective. They highlight FIVE Chinese threat actors: UNC5221, UNC5266, UNC5330, UNC5337, and UNC5291 abusing a mix of CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, and CVE-2024-21893. New TTPs, new malware families and new IOC: ð https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-post-exploitation-lateral-movement

EDIT: For your situational awareness, it's my understanding that future Mandiant articles will be located at https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/

#Ivanti #ConnectSecure #vulnerability #cyberespionage #China #activeexploitation #eitw #zeroday #KEV #CISA #CVE_2023_46805 #CVE_2024_21887 #CVE_2024_21893 #UNC5221 #UNC5266 #UNC5330 #UNC5337 #UNC5291

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-04T14:53:52.000Z ##

Mandiant releases part 4 of the Ivanti Connect Secure incident response investigation. They detail different types of post-exploitation activity across their IR engagements. Chinese threat actors have a growing knowledge of Ivanti Connect Secure in abusing appliance-specific functionality to perform actions on objective. They highlight FIVE Chinese threat actors: UNC5221, UNC5266, UNC5330, UNC5337, and UNC5291 abusing a mix of CVE-2023-46805, CVE-2024-21887, and CVE-2024-21893. New TTPs, new malware families and new IOC: ð https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/ivanti-post-exploitation-lateral-movement

EDIT: For your situational awareness, it's my understanding that future Mandiant articles will be located at https://cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/

CVE-2022-24086
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 22.60%

updated 2024-01-11T18:59:53

2 posts

Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.3-p1 (and earlier) and 2.3.7-p2 (and earlier) are affected by an improper input validation vulnerability during the checkout process. Exploitation of this issue does not require user interaction and could result in arbitrary code execution.

simontsui at 2024-04-06T13:24:24.356Z ##

Why you should care about the exploitation of CVE-2024-20720:
A similar Adobeâ¯Commerce andâ¯Magento Open Source vulnerability CVE-2022-24086 (9.8 critical, disclosed 13 February 2024 by Adobe as a zero-day; improper input validation) was "exploited in the wild in very limited attacks targeting Adobe Commerce merchants." CVE-2022-24086 was added to CISA's KEV Catalog on 15 February 2024, so there is a strong possibility that they would consider CVE-2024-20720. ð https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb22-12.html

#CVE_2024_20720 #Adobe #Commerce #Magento #eitw #activeexploitation #threatintel #IOC

CVE-2023-22518
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.48%

updated 2023-12-28T05:05:44

2 posts

All versions of Confluence Data Center and Server are affected by this unexploited vulnerability. There is no impact to confidentiality as an attacker cannot exfiltrate any instance data. Atlassian Cloud sites are not affected by this vulnerability. If your Confluence site is accessed via an atlassian.net domain, it is hosted by Atlassian and is not vulnerable to this issue.

Nuclei template

8 repos

https://github.com/ForceFledgling/CVE-2023-22518

https://github.com/sanjai-AK47/CVE-2023-22518

https://github.com/davidfortytwo/CVE-2023-22518

https://github.com/bibo318/CVE-2023-22518

https://github.com/0x00sector/CVE_2023_22518_Checker

https://github.com/0x0d3ad/CVE-2023-22518

https://github.com/C1ph3rX13/CVE-2023-22518

https://github.com/Lilly-dox/Exploit-CVE-2023-22518

mle at 2024-04-13T16:06:01.422Z ##

Reading a Sisense community forum discussion post about the incident, there are still questions about whether self-hosted instances were affected as of the morning of 2024-04-13.

Often, CVEs or other exploits against SaaS products with cloud and self-hosted options *only* affect the self-hosted instances (Confluence comes to mind here: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-26084; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-22518).

However, if stories of infiltration via a Sisense GitLab instance are accurate, none of this matters. Per guidance from Sisense and CISA, assuming breach and following the detailed mitigation steps provided (https://twitter.com/marcwrogers/status/1778551164688277988/photo/1) if you're a customer of Sisense in *any* capacity is the correct move here.

https://community.sisense.com/t5/technical-troubleshooting/sisense-security-concern/td-p/20714

##
mle@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-13T16:06:01.000Z ##

Reading a Sisense community forum discussion post about the incident, there are still questions about whether self-hosted instances were affected as of the morning of 2024-04-13.

Often, CVEs or other exploits against SaaS products with cloud and self-hosted options *only* affect the self-hosted instances (Confluence comes to mind here: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-26084; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-22518).

However, if stories of infiltration via a Sisense GitLab instance are accurate, none of this matters. Per guidance from Sisense and CISA, assuming breach and following the detailed mitigation steps provided (https://twitter.com/marcwrogers/status/1778551164688277988/photo/1) if you're a customer of Sisense in *any* capacity is the correct move here.

CVE-2023-35628
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.86%

updated 2023-12-12T18:31:42

2 posts

Windows MSHTML Platform Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

simontsui at 2024-04-14T23:50:10.778Z ##

Akamai provides vulnerability details on CVE-2023-35628 (8.1 high, disclosed 12 December 2023 by Microsoft, Windows MSHTML Platform Remote Code Execution Vulnerability), which they describe as "Windows path parsing memory corruption." They start with the background of the exploited zero-day from March 2023: CVE-2023-23397 and how MapUrlToZone adds a new attack surface. The blog post includes a proof of concept for CVE-2023-35628 and a warning that more MapUrlToZone bypasses may exist. ð https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/critical-vulnerability-create-uri-remote-code-execution

#CVE_2023_35628 #Microsoft #vulnerability #ProofofConcept #PoC #MapUrlToZone #CVE_2023_23397 #Akamai

The blog post includes a proof of concept for CVE-2023-35628 and a warning that more MapUrlToZone bypasses may exist. ð https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/critical-vulnerability-create-uri-remote-code-execution

CVE-2020-29583
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 96.25%

updated 2023-11-05T05:04:43

2 posts

Firmware version 4.60 of Zyxel USG devices contains an undocumented account (zyfwp) with an unchangeable password. The password for this account can be found in cleartext in the firmware. This account can be used by someone to login to the ssh server or web interface with admin privileges.

##

CVE-2023-29389
(6.8 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2023-04-22T05:07:54

5 posts

Toyota RAV4 2021 vehicles automatically trust messages from other ECUs on a CAN bus, which allows physically proximate attackers to drive a vehicle by accessing the control CAN bus after pulling the bumper away and reaching the headlight connector, and then sending forged "Key is validated" messages via CAN Injection, as exploited in the wild in (for example) July 2022.

harald@mementomori.social at 2024-04-08T07:47:58.000Z ##

IMPORTANT VULNERABILITIES

Toyota RAV4 2021 vehicles automatically trust messages
URL: https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3gqh-xgpm-cfvx
Classification: Important, Solution: Not Defined, Exploit Maturity: Unproven, CVSSv3.1: 6.8
CVEs: CVE-2023-29389

Toyota RAV4 2021 vehicles automatically trust messages from other ECUs on a
CAN bus, which allows physically proximate attackers to drive a vehicle by
accessing the control CAN bus after pulling the bumper away and reaching the
headlight connector, and then sending forged "Key is validated" messages via
CAN Injection, as exploited in the wild in (for example) July 2022.

##
simontsui at 2024-04-06T22:24:52.545Z ##

Thinking about car theft and vulnerabilities, @todb you know what would freak people out? If CISA added CVE-2023-29389 (6.5 medium, disclosed 05 April 2023) to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog.

Toyota RAV4 2021 vehicles automatically trust messages from other ECUs on a CAN bus, which allows physically proximate attackers to drive a vehicle by accessing the control CAN bus after pulling the bumper away and reaching the headlight connector, and then sending forged "Key is validated" messages via CAN Injection, as exploited in the wild in (for example) July 2022.

#CVE_2023_29389 #KEV #eitw #activeexploitation #Toyota #RAV4

##
kentindell@mastodon.social at 2024-04-05T11:08:12.000Z ##

Toyota have responded to CVE-2023-29389 (the CAN Injection Attack from reverse engineering by @mintynet and me after Ianâs RAV4 was stolen). It was issued the same day as a BBC Watchdog investigation into high-tech car theft was aired (I appeared on the programme to discuss it).

https://mag.toyota.co.uk/toyota-gb-statement-on-vehicle-theft/

##

Toyota RAV4 2021 vehicles automatically trust messages from other ECUs on a CAN bus, which allows physically proximate attackers to drive a vehicle by accessing the control CAN bus after pulling the bumper away and reaching the headlight connector, and then sending forged "Key is validated" messages via CAN Injection, as exploited in the wild in (for example) July 2022.

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-14T23:50:10.000Z ##

Akamai provides vulnerability details on CVE-2023-35628 (8.1 high, disclosed 12 December 2023 by Microsoft, Windows MSHTML Platform Remote Code Execution Vulnerability), which they describe as "Windows path parsing memory corruption." They start with the background of the exploited zero-day from March 2023: CVE-2023-23397 and how MapUrlToZone adds a new attack surface. The blog post includes a proof of concept for CVE-2023-35628 and a warning that more MapUrlToZone bypasses may exist. ð https://www.akamai.com/blog/security-research/critical-vulnerability-create-uri-remote-code-execution

CVE-2021-3129
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.47%

updated 2023-02-01T05:05:19

2 posts

Ignition before 2.5.2, as used in Laravel and other products, allows unauthenticated remote attackers to execute arbitrary code because of insecure usage of file_get_contents() and file_put_contents(). This is exploitable on sites using debug mode with Laravel before 8.4.2.

simontsui at 2024-04-09T14:29:21.140Z ##

Sysdig provides a threat actor profile on RUBYCARP, described as a Romanian financially motivated threat actor group actively running a botnet for the past 10 years. They have some crossover with the Outlaw APT group. Their payloads are geared towards cryptomining, DDoS, and Phishing. Initial access includes exploitation of CVE-2021-3129 (9.8 critical, disclosed 12 January 2021, in KEV Catalog, Laravel RCE). Sysdig also IRC talks communication and group hierarchy. IOC for crypto mining pools and various IP/domains scattered throughout article.ð https://sysdig.com/blog/rubycarp-romanian-botnet-group/

#RUBYCARP #cybercrime #cryptominer #threatintel #IOC #CVE_2021_3129

##
keefer@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-02T18:13:23.000Z ##

Can anyone help me figure out some discrepancies I'm seeing with #cvss and #nvd data?

I'm doing some research on CVEs for prioritization and weaponization.

CVE-2008-3844 is one of the vulns that stands out due to a high CVSS base score (9.3) + high #EPSS score (.86 percentile).

One of the references in NVD was for an IBM XForce page (link in comment) which shows the CVSS base score as 4.3 and a CVSS temporal score of 3.2.

Anyone know how XForce is getting these numbers? Not seeing similar numbers on NVD. CVSS Temporal scores seem like a promising lead for the research I'm doing but I'm not sure where the best source is for those.

##

CVE-2022-1271
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.60%

updated 2023-01-29T05:04:55

1 posts

An arbitrary file write vulnerability was found in GNU gzip's zgrep utility. When zgrep is applied on the attacker's chosen file name (for example, a crafted file name), this can overwrite an attacker's content to an arbitrary attacker-selected file. This flaw occurs due to insufficient validation when processing filenames with two or more newlines where selected content and the target file names

rye at 2024-04-03T02:49:14.448Z ##

First, you'll don the armor of WinRAR, not to defend against the xz backdoors, but to shield yourself from the icy chill of CVE-2023-38831, a vulnerability that lurks in the shadows, waiting to exploit the trusting user.

Next, you'll don the cloak of PKZip, a tool as ancient as time itself, but with a purpose as sharp as a dagger. It's not just for show; it's your shield against the CVE-2023-38831, a vulnerability that, despite its age, still poses a threat to the unsuspecting.

Then, you'll don the helmet of gzip, a warrior of the digital realm, ready to face the zip-slip, a sneaky little bug that lurks within PKZip's archives, waiting to strike. With gzip, you'll stand your ground, ready to defend against this sneaky attack.

Finally, you'll don the boots of 7zip, a guardian of the digital fortress, your last line of defense against the ever-evolving threats of the digital world, including the notorious CVE-2022-1271, a vulnerability that has been whispered about in the darkest corners of the internet.

So, my dear, prepare yourself for a journey of endless clicking, a testament to your resolve and your commitment to digital security. Just keep clicking, and perhaps, one day, you'll find the document you seek, unscathed and ready to be opened.

simontsui at 2024-04-09T12:50:06.941Z ##

SOCRadar provides a threat actor profile for Mallox Ransomware group. Mallox Ransomware, aka TargetCompany, Tohnichi, and Fargo, is a ransomware group active since mid-2021 using multi-extortion tactics. Their initial infection vector includes exploiting CVE-2019-1068 (8.8 high, disclosed 15 July 2019 by Microsoft, SQL Server RCE) and CVE-2020-0618 (8.8 high, disclosed 11 February 2020 by Microsoft, SQL Server Reporting Services RCE), brute force attacks against internet facing applications, and phishing emails with attachments. SOCRadar provides a description of other TTPs, mapped to MITRE ATT&CK. IOC provided with dates. ð https://socradar.io/dark-web-profile-mallox-ransomware/

CVE-2022-26377
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.90%

updated 2023-01-27T05:04:07

4 posts

Inconsistent Interpretation of HTTP Requests ('HTTP Request Smuggling') vulnerability in mod_proxy_ajp of Apache HTTP Server allows an attacker to smuggle requests to the AJP server it forwards requests to. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server Apache HTTP Server 2.4 version 2.4.53 and prior versions.

1 repos

https://github.com/watchtowrlabs/ibm-qradar-ajp_smuggling_CVE-2022-26377_poc

simontsui at 2024-04-13T13:18:05.803Z ##

watchTowr posts a scathing review of IBM for not updating their dependencies, allowing for the QRadar SIEM product to be vulnerable to CVE-2022-26377 (7.5 high, disclosed 08 June 2022 by Apache) an AJP (Apache JServ Protocol) smuggling vulnerability. The article is a deep-dive into the product, the vulnerability and discovering it. Scroll to the tl;dr to see the impact. watchTowr also has a proof of concept ð https://labs.watchtowr.com/ibm-qradar-when-the-attacker-controls-your-security-stack/

If you follow our leading words, this would allow threat actors (or watchTowr's automation) to assume the session of the user and take control of their QRadar SIEM instance in a single request.

Flagship security software from IBM.

#IBM #QRadar #vulnerability #CVE_2022_26377 #ProofofConcept #PoC

mle at 2024-04-13T16:06:01.422Z ##

Reading a Sisense community forum discussion post about the incident, there are still questions about whether self-hosted instances were affected as of the morning of 2024-04-13.

Often, CVEs or other exploits against SaaS products with cloud and self-hosted options *only* affect the self-hosted instances (Confluence comes to mind here: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2021-26084; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2023-22518).

However, if stories of infiltration via a Sisense GitLab instance are accurate, none of this matters. Per guidance from Sisense and CISA, assuming breach and following the detailed mitigation steps provided (https://twitter.com/marcwrogers/status/1778551164688277988/photo/1) if you're a customer of Sisense in *any* capacity is the correct move here.

https://community.sisense.com/t5/technical-troubleshooting/sisense-security-concern/td-p/20714

##

karlemilnikka@social.nikkasystems.com at 2024-04-10T07:38:37.000Z ##

When working on the latest version of SÃ¤kerhetsbubblanâs event calendar, I found a minor vulnerability in GP Unique ID. Itâs a non-issue for most use cases, except when a form submissionâs value must be truly random or absolutely sequential.

https://github.com/karlemilnikka/CVE-2024-0710/blob/main/README.md

##

CVE-2024-1874
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-04-10T19:50:43.981Z ##

#BatBadBut is not just one CVE ID CVE-2024-24576 (10.0 critical) affecting Rust programming language. It's also CVE-2024-1874, CVE-2024-22423 (8.3 high, for yt-dlp), and CVE-2024-3566 (for Haskell, node.js, Rust, PHP, yt-dlp)... so far. @ryotkak, a security engineer at Flatt Security Inc. said

"I decided to call this vulnerability BatBadBut because itâs about batch files and bad, but not the worst."

The BatBadBut is a vulnerability that allows an attacker to perform command injection on Windows applications that indirectly depend on the CreateProcess function when the specific conditions are satisfied. The root cause of BatBadBut is the overlooked behavior of the CreateProcess function on Windows. When executing batch files with the CreateProcess function, Windows implicitly spawns cmd.exe because Windows canât execute batch files without it. ð https://flatt.tech/research/posts/batbadbut-you-cant-securely-execute-commands-on-windows/ https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/123335

#CVE_2024_22423 #CVE_2024_3566 #CVE_2024_24576 #CVE_2024_1874

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-10T19:50:43.000Z ##

#BatBadBut is not just one CVE ID CVE-2024-24576 (10.0 critical) affecting Rust programming language. It's also CVE-2024-1874, CVE-2024-22423 (8.3 high, for yt-dlp), and CVE-2024-3566 (for Haskell, node.js, Rust, PHP, yt-dlp)... so far. @ryotkak, a security engineer at Flatt Security Inc. said

"I decided to call this vulnerability BatBadBut because itâs about batch files and bad, but not the worst."

The BatBadBut is a vulnerability that allows an attacker to perform command injection on Windows applications that indirectly depend on the CreateProcess function when the specific conditions are satisfied. The root cause of BatBadBut is the overlooked behavior of the CreateProcess function on Windows. When executing batch files with the CreateProcess function, Windows implicitly spawns cmd.exe because Windows canât execute batch files without it. ð https://flatt.tech/research/posts/batbadbut-you-cant-securely-execute-commands-on-windows/ https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/123335

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-10T19:50:43.000Z ##

#BatBadBut is not just one CVE ID CVE-2024-24576 (10.0 critical) affecting Rust programming language. It's also CVE-2024-1874, CVE-2024-22423 (8.3 high, for yt-dlp), and CVE-2024-3566 (for Haskell, node.js, Rust, PHP, yt-dlp)... so far. @ryotkak, a security engineer at Flatt Security Inc. said

"I decided to call this vulnerability BatBadBut because itâs about batch files and bad, but not the worst."

The BatBadBut is a vulnerability that allows an attacker to perform command injection on Windows applications that indirectly depend on the CreateProcess function when the specific conditions are satisfied. The root cause of BatBadBut is the overlooked behavior of the CreateProcess function on Windows. When executing batch files with the CreateProcess function, Windows implicitly spawns cmd.exe because Windows canât execute batch files without it. ð https://flatt.tech/research/posts/batbadbut-you-cant-securely-execute-commands-on-windows/ https://kb.cert.org/vuls/id/123335

##

CVE-2024-2201
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

6 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-04-11T11:19:28.875Z ##

Happy Patch Thursday as Citrix releases a XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor security advisory 2 days late from its initial publication date of 09 April 2024. ð https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX633151/xenserver-and-citrix-hypervisor-security-update-for-cve202346842-cve20242201-and-cve202431142

  • CVE-2023-46842 (unknown CVSS) affects all deployments, may allow malicious privileged code running in a guest VM to cause the host to crash.
  • CVE-2024-2201 and CVE-2024-31142 (unknown CVSS) may allow malicious unprivileged code in a guest VM to infer the contents of memory belonging to its own or other VMs on the same host.
    • CVE-2024-2201 only affects deployments that use Intel CPUs
    • CVE-2024-31142 only affects deployments that use AMD CPUs.

No mention of exploitation in this advisory.

#CVE_2023_46842 #CVE_2024_2201 #CVE_2024_31142 #Citrix #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

    • CVE-2024-31142 only affects deployments that use AMD CPUs.

No mention of exploitation in this advisory.

##
adamw@fosstodon.org at 2024-04-11T06:29:47.000Z ##

today:
* research on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272758 to help blocker determination at #fedora 40 go/no-go tomorrow
* research on CVE-2024-2201 to determine whether we need to block on it (probably not)
* ditto CVE-2024-27983
* testing on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272971
* final check and merge of https://pagure.io/fedora-qa/os-autoinst-distri-fedora/pull-request/304
* wrote a little script for releng to try and avoid mistakes in pungi config updates for f41+ - https://pagure.io/pungi-fedora/pull-request/1276
* updated bodhi PR to fill out the test coverage - https://github.com/fedora-infra/bodhi/pull/5630

##
adamw@fosstodon.org at 2024-04-11T06:29:47.000Z ##

today:
* research on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272758 to help blocker determination at #fedora 40 go/no-go tomorrow
* research on CVE-2024-2201 to determine whether we need to block on it (probably not)
* ditto CVE-2024-27983
* testing on https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2272971
* final check and merge of https://pagure.io/fedora-qa/os-autoinst-distri-fedora/pull-request/304
* wrote a little script for releng to try and avoid mistakes in pungi config updates for f41+ - https://pagure.io/pungi-fedora/pull-request/1276
* updated bodhi PR to fill out the test coverage - https://github.com/fedora-infra/bodhi/pull/5630

CVE-2024-3517
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-04-13T01:44:21.280Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) creates security advisories for the same 3 Chromium vulnerabilities identified in Google Chrome's blog post on Wednesday:

  • CVE-2024-3515 Chromium: CVE-2024-3515 Use after free in Dawn
  • CVE-2024-3516 Chromium: CVE-2024-3516 Heap buffer overflow in ANGLE
  • CVE-2024-3157 Chromium: CVE-2024-3157 Out of bounds write in Compositing

No additional information provided. No mention of exploitation.

#Google #Chrome #vulnerability #MSRC #Microsoft #CVE_2024_3515 #CVE_2024_3516 #CVE_2024_3517

CVE-2023-46842
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-04-11T11:19:28.875Z ##

Happy Patch Thursday as Citrix releases a XenServer and Citrix Hypervisor security advisory 2 days late from its initial publication date of 09 April 2024. ð https://support.citrix.com/article/CTX633151/xenserver-and-citrix-hypervisor-security-update-for-cve202346842-cve20242201-and-cve202431142

  • CVE-2023-46842 (unknown CVSS) affects all deployments, may allow malicious privileged code running in a guest VM to cause the host to crash.
  • CVE-2024-2201 and CVE-2024-31142 (unknown CVSS) may allow malicious unprivileged code in a guest VM to infer the contents of memory belonging to its own or other VMs on the same host.
    • CVE-2024-2201 only affects deployments that use Intel CPUs
    • CVE-2024-31142 only affects deployments that use AMD CPUs.

No mention of exploitation in this advisory.

#CVE_2023_46842 #CVE_2024_2201 #CVE_2024_31142 #Citrix #vulnerability #PatchTuesday

##

CVE-2024-23832
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.10%

2 posts

N/A

vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-04-10T16:24:26.000Z ##

It's been a little while since I posted tracking updates for Mastodon CVE-2024-23832 which was released on February 2, so here we go.

Patched versions are those released on or after that date, so:
- 4.3.0-nightly.2024-02-02+
- 4.3.0-alpha.1+
- 4.2.5+
- 4.1.13+
- 4.0.13+ (EOL)
- 3.5.17+ (EOL)

13% of active servers (meaning it's responded to my queries in the last week and reports someone is still using the instance) still have still not patched over two months later.

However, these are mostly servers with a handful of users and as a result overall user coverage still looks good at 97%.

#MastoAdmin

##
vmstan@vmst.io at 2024-04-10T16:24:26.000Z ##

It's been a little while since I posted tracking updates for Mastodon CVE-2024-23832 which was released on February 2, so here we go.

Patched versions are those released on or after that date, so:
- 4.3.0-nightly.2024-02-02+
- 4.3.0-alpha.1+
- 4.2.5+
- 4.1.13+
- 4.0.13+ (EOL)
- 3.5.17+ (EOL)

13% of active servers (meaning it's responded to my queries in the last week and reports someone is still using the instance) still have still not patched over two months later.

However, these are mostly servers with a handful of users and as a result overall user coverage still looks good at 97%.

#MastoAdmin

##

CVE-2024-27919
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

4 posts

N/A

1 repos

https://github.com/lockness-Ko/CVE-2024-27316

catsalad at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.371Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http
â ï¸â CVE-2024-28182 â nghttp2 library
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27316 â Apache Httpd
â ï¸â CVE-2024-31309 â Apache Traffic Server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

â¸»

  • CVE-2024-27983 (high severity) Node.js DoS
  • CVE-2024-2653 (8.2 high) amphp/http DoS
  • CVE-2024-27316 (unknown) Apache HTTP Server (httpd) DoS
  • CVE-2024-24549 (unknown) Apache Tomcat DoS
  • CVE-2024-31309 (unknown) Apache Traffic Server
  • CVE-2024-27919 (7.5 high) Envoy proxy (oghttp) DoS
  • CVE-2024-30255 (5.3 medium) Envoy proxy (nghttp2) DoS
  • CVE-2023-45288 GoLang DoS (analyst note: GoLang mistakenly used a 2023 CVE ID)
  • CVE-2024-28182 (unknown) nghttp2 DoS
  • CVE-2024-2758 (unknown) Tempesta FTW DoS

#DoS #HTTP2 #CONTINUATION

##
catsalad@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-10T09:39:46.000Z ##

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

Relevant Links

Vulnerability Note VU#421644
https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/421644

Technical Details by Bartek Nowotarski
https://nowotarski.info/http2-continuation-flood-technical-details/ (ðï¸â Archive)

CVE IDs:
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27983 â Node.js HTTP/â 2 server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27919 â Envoy's oghttp codec
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2758 â Tempesta FW
â ï¸â CVE-2024-2653 â amphp/â http
â ï¸â CVE-2024-28182 â nghttp2 library
â ï¸â CVE-2024-27316 â Apache Httpd
â ï¸â CVE-2024-31309 â Apache Traffic Server
â ï¸â CVE-2024-30255 â Envoy < 1.29.2
â ï¸â CVE-2023-45288 â Go packages net/â http and net/â http2

â¸»
#InfoSec #CyberSecurity #CVE #DoS #HTTP2 #Vulnerability #ï¸â£CatSalad

HTTP/2 CONTINUATION Flood DoS

Date: 2024-04-03

HTTP allows for named fields in the header and trailer sections of a message, and HTTP/â 2 header and trailer field sections are serialized as field blocks to allow for fragmented stream transmission.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

This HTTP/â 2 CONTINUATION Flood attack has a more severe impact on a single machine than the previous HTTP/â 2 Rapid Reset vulnerability.

A vulnerability within multiple HTTP/â 2 implementations was discovered by Bartek Nowotarski that does not limit the amount of CONTINUATION frames which can be transmitted in a single stream. Successful exploitation allows for a DoS attack against vulnerable systems.

CVE-2024-26014
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

simontsui at 2024-04-09T14:51:03.402Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from your friends at Fortinet. 13 security advisories, 15 vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation in the wild:

  • FG-IR-23-087 CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical) [FortiClient Linux] Remote Code Execution due to dangerous nodejs configuration
  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure
  • FG-IR-23-493 CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) FortiOS & FortiProxy - administrator cookie leakage
  • FG-IR-23-454 CVE-2024-23671 (8.1 high) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file delete on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-060 CVE-2024-31487 (5.9 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file read on endpoint
  • FG-IR-23-416 CVE-2023-47541 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file write on CLI leading to arbitrary code execution
  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-489 CVE-2024-21755 and CVE-2024-21756 (8.8 high) FortiSandbox - OS command injection on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

#PatchTuesday #Fortinet #FortiManager #vulnerability #FortiSandbox #FortiOS #FortiProxy

simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-09T14:51:03.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from your friends at Fortinet. 13 security advisories, 15 vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation in the wild:

  • FG-IR-23-087 CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical) [FortiClient Linux] Remote Code Execution due to dangerous nodejs configuration
  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure
  • FG-IR-23-493 CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) FortiOS & FortiProxy - administrator cookie leakage
  • FG-IR-23-454 CVE-2024-23671 (8.1 high) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file delete on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-060 CVE-2024-31487 (5.9 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file read on endpoint
  • FG-IR-23-416 CVE-2023-47541 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file write on CLI leading to arbitrary code execution
  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-489 CVE-2024-21755 and CVE-2024-21756 (8.8 high) FortiSandbox - OS command injection on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

  • FG-IR-23-087 CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical) [FortiClient Linux] Remote Code Execution due to dangerous nodejs configuration
  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure

  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure
  • FG-IR-23-493 CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) FortiOS & FortiProxy - administrator cookie leakage
  • FG-IR-23-454 CVE-2024-23671 (8.1 high) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file delete on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-060 CVE-2024-31487 (5.9 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file read on endpoint
  • FG-IR-23-416 CVE-2023-47541 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file write on CLI leading to arbitrary code execution
  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-489 CVE-2024-21755 and CVE-2024-21756 (8.8 high) FortiSandbox - OS command injection on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

#PatchTuesday #Fortinet #FortiManager #vulnerability #FortiSandbox #FortiOS #FortiProxy

##
simontsui@infosec.exchange at 2024-04-09T14:51:03.000Z ##

Happy Patch Tuesday from your friends at Fortinet. 13 security advisories, 15 vulnerabilities. No mention of exploitation in the wild:

  • FG-IR-23-087 CVE-2023-45590 (9.6 critical) [FortiClient Linux] Remote Code Execution due to dangerous nodejs configuration
  • FG-IR-23-345 CVE-2023-45588 and CVE-2024-31492 (8.2 high) FortiClientMac - Lack of configuration file validation
  • FG-IR-23-419 CVE-2023-47542 (6.7 medium) FortiManager - Code Injection via Jinja Template
  • FG-IR-23-288 CVE-2023-48785 (4.8 medium) FortiNAC-F - Lack of certificate validation
  • FG-IR-23-413 CVE-2023-48784 (6.7 medium) FortiOS - Format String in CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-224 CVE-2024-23662 (5.3 medium ) FortiOS - Web server ETag exposure
  • FG-IR-23-493 CVE-2023-41677 (7.5 high) FortiOS & FortiProxy - administrator cookie leakage
  • FG-IR-23-454 CVE-2024-23671 (8.1 high) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file delete on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-060 CVE-2024-31487 (5.9 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file read on endpoint
  • FG-IR-23-416 CVE-2023-47541 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Arbitrary file write on CLI leading to arbitrary code execution
  • FG-IR-23-411 CVE-2023-47540 (6.7 medium) FortiSandbox - Command injection impacting CLI command
  • FG-IR-23-489 CVE-2024-21755 and CVE-2024-21756 (8.8 high) FortiSandbox - OS command injection on endpoint
  • FG-IR-24-009 CVE-2024-26014 (5.3 medium) SMTP Smuggling (analyst note: third party vulnerability)

CVE-2024-27982
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

svrjs@mastodon.social at 2024-04-03T17:11:26.000Z ##

IMPORTANT! Update Node.JS to 18.20.1, 20.12.1, 21.7.2 or newer! Older versions of Node.JS had a CVE-2024-27982 vulnerability, which involves placing a space before "Content-Length" and smuggling in another request.

Read more in https://blog.svrjs.org/2024/04/13/IMPORTANT-Update-Node-JS-to-18-20-1-20-12-1-21-7-2-or-newer/

#cybersecurity #nodejs #javascript
